content.question: Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answers. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes. If the question prompts you to “Calculate,” you must show how you arrived at your final answer.AirCab is the only airline that flies to and from a small island nation. It is currently operating while earning short-run negative economic profit.(a) Draw a correctly labeled graph for AirCab and show each of the following.(i) The profit-maximizing quantity of flights, labeled <math alttext="Q sub F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>(ii) The profit-maximizing price charged by AirCab, labeled <math alttext="P sub F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>(b) Will the deadweight loss change if AirCab were to earn positive economic profit because of a decrease in fixed costs? Explain.(c) Assume the government wants AirCab to provide the allocatively efficient quantity of flights.(i) Which of the following would best achieve that objective: a lump-sum tax, a per-unit tax, a per-unit subsidy, or a price floor?(ii) On your graph in part (a), show the quantity, labeled <math alttext="Q sub G" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>G</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the price, labeled <math alttext="P sub G" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>G</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, consistent with allocative efficiency in the market for AirCab flights.(d) Assume the cross-price elasticity of demand between AirCab’s flights and Good L is <math alttext="positive 1.4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>1.4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. If the price of Good L decreases by <math alttext="2%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>2%</mtext></math>, by how much will the quantity of AirCab flights change?(e) Suppose the airports out of which AirCab flies decrease the landing fee they charge for each of AirCab’s flights.(i) How will this impact AirCab’s profit-maximizing quantity of flights as compared to <math alttext="Q sub F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>? Explain.(ii) How will this impact AirCab’s total revenue? Explain.
